subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Ghost Box Demo at Moundsville WV
author: April Abercrombie
full_text:
------=_NextPart_000_001D_01C9DED1.C8128D80
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

I say they put themselves in there, they can get themselves out.

  ----- O=
riginal Message ----- 
  From: Steve Hill 
  To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com 
 =
 Sent: Wednesday, May 27, 2009 1:40 PM
  Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Ghost Box D=
emo at Moundsville WV






  Yes, you need speical permission. I was there=
 for an all night ghost hunt as a guest of Eastern Paranormal. The place ca=
n be rented at night but believe me when i say "it ain't cheap". Plus I don=
't think the prison would appreciate me releaseing the inmates before their=
 eternal sentence has been served.
  Steve




----------------------------=
--------------------------------------------------
  From: "SnowfireL@aol.c=
om" <SnowfireL@...>
  To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
  Sent: Wednesday, Ma=
y 27, 2009 2:31:57 PM
  Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Ghost Box Demo at Moundsvill=
e WV



  Does one need special permission to get in there?  You folks shou=
ld go back, and release them since a few of them already know you Steve, th=
is is Steve?  Right?  sf

  In a message dated 5/27/2009 2:15:10 P.M. Easte=
rn Daylight Time, foreverhaunted57@ yahoo.com writes:




    Unfortunately=
 I did not get to attempt to cross them. After my demonstration, another gr=
oup that was also there started complaining that the box made too much nois=
e and was hendering their investigation so I turned it off. I wouldn't want=
 my direct communication with the deceased inmates to mess up their EVP wor=
k, now would I? I apoligized and put it away for the rest of the night.
   =
  According to the prison staff, the inmates firmly believed that if they d=
ied in prison their souls would be forever trapped there. This belief was s=
o strong that the prison officials would take the elderly inmates who were =
dying of natural causes to a local hospital so they would'nt have to die in=
 the prison. Maybe their beliefs were well founded.     




--------------=
--------------------------------------------------------------
    From: "S=
nowfireL@aol. com" <SnowfireL@aol. com>
    To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
  =
  Sent: Wednesday, May 27, 2009 12:36:12 PM
    Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Ghos=
t Box Demo at Moundsville WV



    This is a wonderful recording, were you=
 able to free any of them?  So sad to see them still there behind bars, mus=
t be very lonely for them, they should be moving on so, they can start to w=
ork on making up for things on the other side.  You folks should go up ther=
e again, and hold a small prayer vigil for them, of course they would no lo=
nger be ghosts trapped there, but there are plenty more around. sf

    In =
a message dated 5/27/2009 12:10:56 P.M. Eastern Daylight Time, foreverhaunt=
ed57@ yahoo.com writes:



      I was invited to spend the night in the We=
st Virginia Penitentiary this past weekend.. I was asked to give a short de=
monstration with my Optimus 12-797 hacked radio. Deep inside the prison sur=
rounded by concrete and steel, the radio could not pick up any radio statio=
ns in manual mode. I wasn't sure how this might effect the demonstration. I=
 was pleasantly suprised with the results. I recorded the session and the r=
esults can be heard at this link. http://www.youtube. com/watch? v=3DKwDYu4=
RULlk
